author: david_roemer
post: Since Jerry Coyne is incapable of discussing biological evolution honestly, reading his views on religion is a waste of time. His colleague at the U. Of Chicago, James Shapiro, advanced the theory that the new paradigm for the source of innovations in evolution is “natural genetic engineering,” replacing the old paradigm of “random mutations.” Coyne ridicules this idea. I’m not qualified to say who is right, but my guess is that Coyne just hates the word “engineering” because it implies that there is an engineer. Coyne is a fanatic as the link I gave to his blog yesterday proved..
title: Jerry Coyne Pounces on the Earthquake Hypothesis

author: david_roemer
post: I’m involved in a blatant example of physicists lying about science in order to promote atheism. Creationist have the incorrect, but intelligible, idea that evolution violates the second law of thermodynamics, according to which a sugar cube dissolves in a cup of coffee but does not un dissolve. Creationists quite stupidly see an analogy between a sugar cube and a protein. The American Journal of Physics (Am. J. Phys., Vol. 76, No. 11, November 2008) published an article saying evolution does not violate the second law because of the sun. This is literally unintelligible. What is more, the article contains a fake calculation to prove it. I have told my congressman about it (Yvette Clarke, D NY, 9th district), and the matter is being investigated. This article undermines the integrity of science..
title: Quote for Today: Stephen Jones on journalists and their readers
